text: (gentle music)
- My name is Mehnaz Hussain
and I'm a software engineer at AWS.

I've been working at
Amazon for about five years
and AWS, about three and a half.
I was looking for a new challenge

from the previous org
that I was working in.
I always wanted to explore more,

and I wanted to go into like
infrastructure side of things
and see what that is.

Previously, I was a little
more bent towards software side

and there was like
barely an infrastructure
and then when I moved to AWS,
it's like a lot of infrastructure.

You know, like that was
very interesting for me

to, you know, like look
into, learn, and work on.
At one point, we were automating patching
for our enterprise customers.

I think that was the most
interesting part for me,

like just seeing ton of customer
instances getting patched

and, you know, like having
a schedule for, you know,
like automated patching

instead of manually
going and patching them.

That was like one of the
interesting projects I worked on.

The most meaningful part of
my normal day-to-day life
at AWS mostly is the team I work on.

The team is very, very
friendly and super fun.
I never felt like I was just alone.
I'm there to help people.
They're there to help me.
I just feel like it's like a small family.

At my current team, there is
a great work-life balance.
You don't have to have a set timing
as long as you finish your work.
So I think that is like very cool,

you know, that I have
that flexibility at work.
(gentle music)
